result.name: human

result.pre: In this study, one gene,
result.post: , containing a NAC domain with an unknown function, was identified from and characterized in Ara
result.name: human

result.pre: ehiscent anthers throughout flower development. It was therefore surmised that the function of the
result.post: gene is related to the regulation of anther dehiscence.
result.name: human

result.pre: This hypothesis was supported by the expression pattern of the
result.post: gene during flower development. GUS activity was detected in the anthers, the upper part of the fi
result.name: human

result.pre: owers after stage 12 ( Fig. 2). It is reasonable to suggest that the function of the
result.post: gene is to inhibit anther dehiscence during the early stages of flower development. When AIF</i
result.name: human
